subject: Re: Hey guys, we are currently on the Enterprise 4 plan. What happens o...
preview: Hello!  Your plan has now been moved to a Custom plan offering the below specifications as requested:  Sites: 175 Visits: 3,500,000 Disk space: 525GB CDN bandwidth: 1000GB PHP workers: 16 $1800/month

full_threads.body:
Hello!

Your plan has now been moved to a Custom plan offering the below specifications as requested:

Sites: 175
Visits: 3,500,000
Disk space: 525GB
CDN bandwidth: 1000GB
PHP workers: 16
$1800/month

The features of this plan are available for your use immediately. Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns!
Thanks,
Laurey

--

Laurey from Kinsta

Hi Tom/Sales Team,

Can we please upgrade to the 175 sites as discussed in this email chain ASAP? Assuming this is still the best deal/approach you can offer us?

Thanks and speak soon,

Heath

Help Tom understand how they're doing:

Rate your conversation

Heath,

You're welcome! I'll put a note on your with a link to this ticket for when you're ready to move forward. When the time comes, just reach out to our sales team and we'll be able to get it going for you!

Have a great weekend!

Thanks,
Tom

--

Tom from Kinsta

Hi Tom, 

Thanks for this, I think that's fair and works for us. 

So what's the next step? Do I just let you know when we are ready to jump up to this plan? And then the next?

Hi Heath,

Thanks for this information! Here's what these two boil down to:

Sites: 175
Visits: 3,500,000
Disk space: 525GB
CDN bandwidth: 1000GB
$1800/month

Sites: 200
Visits: 4,000,000
Disk space: 600GB
CDN bandwidth: 1000GB
$1975/month

Let me know your thoughts and we can go from there!

Thanks,
Tom

--

Tom from Kinsta

Thank you for the feedback.

I am going to be transferring this conversation back to our Sales team for assistance. Please note that they are not available on a real-time, live chat basis like we here in Support are. The Sales team works more traditional Monday-Friday North American business hours, so you can expect a reply during those times as soon as possible.

You do not need to wait here in MyKinsta for a response. If you're not logged in when a member of the Sales team replies, you will receive an email. You can reply to that email or log back into MyKinsta and respond to the conversation there.

Since I am transferring this conversation to the Sales team, no one on the Support team will see further responses. If you need any assistance on a support issue, please go ahead and open a new conversation right here in MyKinsta. We're here 24/7 to help!

--

Joeri from Kinsta

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi Tom, 

Sure, the 'metrics' for the Enterprise 4 seem to be a good fit e.g 

Sites: 150
Visits: 3,000,000 (20,000/site)
Disk space: 200GB (1.3GB)
CDN bandwidth: 1000GB (n/a)

I do think we would benefit from more disk space and less CDN bandwidth: So, in my mind, if we go for another 25 sites, it could look like: 

Sites: 175
Visits: 3,500,000
Disk space: 525GB (based on 3GB/site)
CDN bandwidth: 1000GB (not fussed on this as we don't use it currently)

And then: 

Sites: 200
Visits: 4,000,000
Disk space: 600GB (based on 3GB/site)
CDN bandwidth: 1000GB (not fussed on this as we don't use it currently)

Let me know what you think? We are currently growing at about 10 - 12 sites per month, hence why I'm keen to go up in blocks of 25 to manage the cashflow. I'm hoping there are some economies of scale and the more site we on board the less our effect cost per site becomes?

Hi Heath,

I've reviewed the conversation, and I do have a question. We don't really sell or price our plans in blocks such as you're describing. To best provide solid pricing options to you, we'll need to know the specs for each quote:

Sites:
Visits:
Disk space:
CDN bandwidth:

Armed with that information, we can come up with the two options for you!

Thanks,
Tom

--

Tom from Kinsta

Hi Heath,

I wanted to chime in and let you know that Shelby is out unexpectedly, but that I am reviewing the conversation you've had with him thus far and that I will be providing the two options to you later today!

Sorry for the delay!

Thanks,

Tom Sepper
Chief Customer Officer

--

Tom from Kinsta

Hey Heath,

Thanks for getting back to me about this, and sounds great. It will take me a little bit of time to throw a couple together for you. Thanks for your patience and I will let you know if I have any other questions along the way when creating these for you :)

Thanks,

Shelby DeNike

--

Shelby from Kinsta

Hi Shelby,

Thanks for this, can I request pricing for both options and then make my final decision please?

Hey Heath,

Thanks for getting back to me about this. Since you are lower on the visits but higher on the disk and are wanting more sites, I should be able to decrease the included visits to lower the cost while adding in additional sites and more disk space since that seems to be where you are growing. If that sounds good I can go ahead and look into a custom plan that would suite your needs, unless you wanted to keep the visits where they are at though it may not lower the price per site enough for you.

Thanks,

Shelby DeNike

--

Shelby from Kinsta

Hi Shelby, 

Thanks for getting back to me. Currently we are growing our account at approximately 5-10 sites per month. So I would like to map out the next few milestones or some sort of plan if that makes sense. I need to be able to budget and forecast for the increase in the amount of sites. 

Most important seems to be the disk space usage, as we tend to be quite high on that. We using no CDN and our traffic never gets more than 30% of our total allocation at the moment. 

Would it be possible sell us extra sites in blocks of about 20? So currently we have capacity for 150 sites, and then if we upgrade, we would have capacity for 170 sites and so on? Ideally this is a sliding scale as well, so as we add more sites, our effective cost per site would decrease. Does something like this work for you?

Hey!

Thanks for reaching out to us, I understand you are looking for a plan that allows for more sites? I can certainly create a custom plan that caters to your exact needs!

Do you require additional disk space, CDN, or unique visits as well that I can bake into the custom plan for you? Also let me know how many more additional sites you would like added :)

Thanks,

Shelby DeNike

--
Shelby from Kinsta

Is there a plan?
